trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Oxford
There were no other sightings in Oxford on or around May 2nd 2008
divs: Sighting DetailsAT HOME IN OXFORD, UK, 2ND OF MAY 2008. AWAKE AT 2AM. THERE WAS A SOUND LIKE A LARGE EXPLOSION SUBDUED BY DISTANCE, AFTER APPROXIMATELY 2 MINUTES AT 2.22AM I LOOKED OUT OF WINDOW AND EVENTUALY BECAME AWARE OF AN OVERLY BRIGHT STAR. IT WAS A LARGE WHITE STATIONARY STAR-LIKE LIGHT. A HELICOPTER OR AIRPLANE WAS CROSSING THE SAME PART OF THE SKY BUT MUCH CLOSER TO EARTH, I WATCHED TO SEE THE LIGHT MORE CLEARLY WHEN THE CRAFT PASSED (IN A TYPICAL FLIGHT PATTERN) AND AS IT DID PASS THE LIGHT BECAME MUCH BRIGHTER AND THEN SEEMED TO RETREAT VERTICALLY AT HIGH SPEED BECOMING INVISIBLE. I THOUGHT ABOUT THE EVENT THIS MORNING AND CONSIDERED THAT THE LIGHT COULD NOT HAVE BEEN METROLOGICAL, A STAR OR PLANET.
Summary: LARGE WHITE STATIONARY STAR-LIKE LIGHT THAT RETREATED VERTICALLY AT HIGH SPEED
